org.openstreetmap.josm.gradle.plugin.config

Class I18nConfig

  • org.openstreetmap.josm.gradle.plugin.config.I18nConfig

  • public class I18nConfig

    Holds configuration options regarding internationalization.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      I18nConfig(org.gradle.api.Project project)
      Holds configuration options regarding internationalization.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getBugReportEmail()
      E-Mail address to which bugs regarding i18n should be reported. This will be put into the *.pot files that are forwarded to the translators.
      java.lang.String getCopyrightHolder()
      Person or organization that holds the copyright on the project. This will appear in the header of the *.pot file as follows:
      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getGithubPathTransformer(java.lang.String repoSlug)
      Creates a path transformer for a project hosted on GitHub. Supply a repo slug (username/repo) and this method will return a function, which you can use as value for the field pathTransformer.
      java.lang.String getMainLanguage()
      The main language is in this context the language used in the raw strings occuring in the source code. It's the starting point on which the translators will base their translations. Use the language codes, which you also use to name the *.po, *.mo or *.lang files.
      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPathTransformer()
      Replaces each occurence of the value of Project.getProjectDir in all file paths of the generated *.pot file.
      void pathTransformer(groovy.lang.Closure<java.lang.String> closure)
      Alternative to setPathTransformer, can set the pathTransformer field using a Groovy Closure.

      E-Mail address to which bugs regarding i18n should be reported. This will be put into the *.pot files that are forwarded to the translators.

      Person or organization that holds the copyright on the project. This will appear in the header of the *.pot file as follows:
      void setMainLanguage(java.lang.String p)
      The main language is in this context the language used in the raw strings occuring in the source code. It's the starting point on which the translators will base their translations. Use the language codes, which you also use to name the *.po, *.mo or *.lang files.

      Replaces each occurence of the value of Project.getProjectDir in all file paths of the generated *.pot file.

        public I18nConfig(org.gradle.api.Project project)

    • Method Detail

      • getBugReportEmail

        public java.lang.String getBugReportEmail()

        E-Mail address to which bugs regarding i18n should be reported. This will be put into the *.pot files that are forwarded to the translators.

        Default value: null

      • setBugReportEmail

        public void setBugReportEmail(java.lang.String p)

        E-Mail address to which bugs regarding i18n should be reported. This will be put into the *.pot files that are forwarded to the translators.

        Default value: null

      • getCopyrightHolder

        public java.lang.String getCopyrightHolder()

        Person or organization that holds the copyright on the project. This will appear in the header of the *.pot file as follows:

        # Copyright (C) YEAR THE PACKAGE'S COPYRIGHT HOLDER

        Default value: null

      • setCopyrightHolder

        public void setCopyrightHolder(java.lang.String p)

        Person or organization that holds the copyright on the project. This will appear in the header of the *.pot file as follows:

        # Copyright (C) YEAR THE PACKAGE'S COPYRIGHT HOLDER

        Default value: null

      • getMainLanguage

        public java.lang.String getMainLanguage()

        The main language is in this context the language used in the raw strings occuring in the source code. It's the starting point on which the translators will base their translations. Use the language codes, which you also use to name the *.po, *.mo or *.lang files.

        Default value: en

      • setMainLanguage

        public void setMainLanguage(java.lang.String p)

        The main language is in this context the language used in the raw strings occuring in the source code. It's the starting point on which the translators will base their translations. Use the language codes, which you also use to name the *.po, *.mo or *.lang files.

        Default value: en

      • getPathTransformer

        public kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPathTransformer()

        Replaces each occurence of the value of Project.getProjectDir in all file paths of the generated *.pot file.

        For each translated string the *.pot file points to the location in the source code (lines starting with #: ). Each of those lines is put through this transformer (without the leading #: ).

        Default value: {a -> a} (identity)

        See Also:
        Project.getProjectDir

      • setPathTransformer

        public void setPathTransformer(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super java.lang.String,java.lang.String> p)

        Replaces each occurence of the value of Project.getProjectDir in all file paths of the generated *.pot file.

        For each translated string the *.pot file points to the location in the source code (lines starting with #: ). Each of those lines is put through this transformer (without the leading #: ).

        Default value: {a -> a} (identity)

        See Also:
        Project.getProjectDir

      • pathTransformer

        public void pathTransformer(groovy.lang.Closure<java.lang.String> closure)

        Alternative to setPathTransformer, can set the pathTransformer field using a Groovy Closure.

        See Also:
        setPathTransformer, Closure

      • getGithubPathTransformer

        public kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getGithubPathTransformer(java.lang.String repoSlug)

        Creates a path transformer for a project hosted on GitHub. Supply a repo slug (username/repo) and this method will return a function, which you can use as value for the field pathTransformer.
